Python is a high-level, interpreted programming language known for its readability and simplicity.
Python was created by Guido van Rossum, and its first version was released in 1991.
Python was created in 1991 as a successor to the ABC language to emphasize code readability.
Python is used for web development, AI, data science, automation, scripting, and more.
Yes, Python is beginner-friendly due to its simple syntax and large supportive community.
Python supports int, float, str, bool, list, tuple, set, and dict as primary data types.
A list is an ordered, mutable collection that allows duplicate values.
A tuple is an ordered, immutable collection that is defined using parentheses ().
Lists are mutable, whereas tuples are immutable and consume less memory.
A dictionary is a key-value pair collection that allows fast lookups and modifications.
A set is an unordered collection of unique elements used for membership testing.
A variable is a named reference to a value that does not require explicit type declaration.
Variables are declared by assignment, e.g., x = 10 assigns the value 10 to x.
Yes, Python is dynamically typed, meaning variable types are determined at runtime.
A function is a reusable block of code that performs a specific task.
Functions are defined using the def keyword, e.g., def greet(): print('Hello').
A lambda function is an anonymous, one-liner function defined using lambda.
A function is defined using def, whereas a lambda function is a single expression.
Recursion is when a function calls itself to solve problems like factorial or Fibonacci.
A class is created using the class keyword, e.g., class Car: pass.
self represents the instance of the class and allows access to its attributes and methods.
Inheritance allows a class to derive properties and methods from another class.
Python supports single, multiple, multilevel, hierarchical, and hybrid inheritance.
Polymorphism allows methods to take different forms based on the context.
Encapsulation restricts direct access to data and allows controlled modification.
Abstraction hides implementation details and only shows essential features.
Exceptions are handled using try, except, and finally blocks.
try and except handle exceptions and prevent program crashes.
finally executes code regardless of whether an exception occurs or not.
A list allows duplicates and maintains order, whereas a set contains unique items.
== checks for value equality, while is checks for object identity.
__init__ is a constructor method that initializes objects in a class.
super() allows access to parent class methods and constructors.
Files are read using open(filename, 'r').read() or a with statement.
Files are written using open(filename, 'w').write('data').
r+ allows both reading and writing without truncating; w+ overwrites the file.
Files can be deleted using os.remove(filename).
The os module provides functions for interacting with the operating system.
The shutil module is used for file operations like copying and moving.
Files can be copied using shutil.copy(source, destination).
Files can be renamed using os.rename(old_name, new_name).
Regex (Regular Expressions) is a sequence of characters used for pattern matching.
Regex is used with the re module in Python, e.g., re.match(pattern, text).
The re module provides regex functions like match(), search(), and findall().
match checks for a pattern at the beginning, while search scans the whole string.
Threading allows concurrent execution of tasks in a single process.
Multiprocessing runs processes independently to utilize multiple CPU cores.
GIL (Global Interpreter Lock) restricts Python from executing multiple threads in parallel.
A virtual environment is created using python -m venv env_name to manage dependencies.
Java is a high-level, object-oriented programming language known for its platform independence.
JavaScript is a lightweight, interpreted scripting language mainly used for web development.
C++ is an extension of C that supports object-oriented programming and is used for system software and game development.
C# is a modern, object-oriented language developed by Microsoft, commonly used for Windows applications and game development.
PHP is a server-side scripting language designed for web development, widely used for building dynamic websites.
Ruby is a dynamic, object-oriented scripting language known for its simplicity and productivity.
Swift is a programming language developed by Apple for building iOS and macOS applications.
Kotlin is a modern programming language designed for Android development, interoperable with Java.
Rust is a systems programming language focused on memory safety and performance.
Go is a statically typed, compiled language by Google, designed for efficiency and scalability.
TypeScript is a superset of JavaScript that adds static typing for better code reliability.
SQL (Structured Query Language) is used to manage and manipulate relational databases.
R is a language designed for statistical computing and data analysis.
MATLAB is a high-level language used for numerical computing and simulations.
Dart is a language developed by Google, primarily used for Flutter app development.
Scala is a JVM-based language that combines object-oriented and functional programming.
Perl is a high-level scripting language known for text processing and automation.
Lua is a lightweight scripting language often used in game development.
Haskell is a functional programming language emphasizing purity and lazy evaluation.
Objective-C is an older programming language used for iOS/macOS development before Swift.
Bash is a Unix shell and command language used for scripting and automation.
Shell scripting is writing scripts using shell commands to automate tasks in Unix/Linux.
Lisp is one of the oldest programming languages, known for its use in AI and symbolic processing.
Julia is a high-performance programming language used for numerical computing.
F# is a functional-first programming language that runs on the .NET framework.
COBOL is an old but still-used programming language for business and financial applications.
Fortran is a high-level language used for scientific and engineering applications.
Assembly language is a low-level language that directly interacts with CPU instructions.
VBA (Visual Basic for Applications) is used for automating tasks in Microsoft Office applications.
Prolog is a logic programming language often used in AI and expert systems.
Elixir is a functional, concurrent programming language built on the Erlang VM.
Erlang is a language designed for distributed and fault-tolerant systems.
Groovy is a scripting language for the Java platform with dynamic and static typing.
PowerShell is a scripting language and shell designed for Windows automation.
Nim is a statically typed compiled language with a focus on performance and efficiency.
Crystal is a language similar to Ruby but compiled for better performance.
Scheme is a minimalist dialect of Lisp, widely used for teaching and research.
Ada is a high-level language designed for mission-critical systems and embedded software.
TCL (Tool Command Language) is used for scripting and automation in networking and testing.
ABAP is a programming language developed by SAP for enterprise applications.
Smalltalk is an object-oriented programming language known for its simplicity and flexibility.
PL/SQL is Oracle's procedural extension to SQL for writing database scripts.
AWK is a scripting language used for pattern scanning and text processing.
Q# is Microsoft's quantum programming language used for quantum computing applications.
Solidity is a contract-oriented language used for writing smart contracts on Ethereum.
VHDL (VHSIC Hardware Description Language) is used for designing digital circuits.
Verilog is a hardware description language used in electronic design automation.
OCaml is a functional programming language with object-oriented and imperative features.
PostScript is a page description language used for printing and typesetting.
ActionScript is a programming language used for Adobe Flash applications.
REXX is a scripting language developed by IBM for automation and data processing.
XSLT (Extensible Stylesheet Language Transformations) is used for transforming XML documents.
